title: Harry Maguire has to be called over by the referee after forgetting the coin toss
text:
Thursday night was a proud moment for Harry Maguire as he captained Manchester United for the first time.

But it seems the 26-year-old is a little bit unaccustomed with the responsibilities of the armband after he forgot to attend the coin toss.

He had to be beckoned over by referee Xavier Estrada Fernandez after jogging off to join his team-mates ahead of the clash with Partizan Belgrade.

Harry Maguire had to be beckoned over after forgetting the pre-match coin toss

The England defender was captaining Manchester United for the first time

A video released by broadcaster BT Sport shows the official shouting 'Maguire! Harry!', before the skipper for the night sheepishly trundles over to the halfway line.

He performed the pre-game custom of exchanging pendants with gusto and then called correctly as the referee asked him to choose between red and blue, instead of the two sides of a coin.

Maguire later offered an excuse on Twitter, highlighting how long it had been since he last captained a side.

He wrote: 'Last time I did this you did the coin toss in the centre circle. It's been a long time'.

The Europa League group stage meeting in Serbia was Maguire's first occasion wearing the armband since his record-breaking move to Old Trafford in the summer.

It was just Maguire's 10th appearance in a United shirt since his summer move from Leicester.

He was skippering in the absence of club captain Ashley Young and vice skipper David de Gea.

"MAGUIRE!" "HARRY!"



On his first appearance in European competition, Harry Maguire captains Man Utd...



And he forgot to stick around for the coin toss 😂 pic.twitter.com/eanTEx0ccM — Football on BT Sport (@btsportfootball) October 24, 2019

He sheepishly jogged over before shaking hands with the officials on the halfway line
description: Thursday night was a proud moment for Harry Maguire as he captained Manchester United for the first time. But it seems he is a bit unaccustomed with the responsibilities of the armband.
